# Importar dados


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
comp <- c( "9", "12.5", "10", "8", "13.2", "11", "10.8", "9.5", "10.8", "10.4", "13.72", "15.91", "15.7", "14.2", "15.9", "16.54", "18", "14.4", "16.41", "16")


dat <- data.frame(
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE,
              trat = c("Mg2","Mg2","Mg2","Mg2",
                       "Mg2","Mg2","Mg2","Mg2","Mg2","Mg2","control",
                       "control","control","control","control","control","control",
                       "control","control","control"),
               rep = c(1L,2L,3L,4L,5L,6L,7L,8L,
                       9L,10L,1L,2L,3L,4L,5L,6L,7L,8L,9L,10L),
              comp = c(9,12.5,10,8,13.2,11,10.8,
                       9.5,10.8,10.4,13.72,15.91,15.7,14.2,15.9,16.54,
                       18,14.4,16.41,16)
)
dat
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
      trat rep  comp
1      Mg2   1  9.00
2      Mg2   2 12.50
3      Mg2   3 10.00
4      Mg2   4  8.00
5      Mg2   5 13.20
6      Mg2   6 11.00

8      Mg2   8  9.50
9      Mg2   9 10.80
10     Mg2  10 10.40
11 control   1 13.72
12 control   2 15.91
13 control   3 15.70
14 control   4 14.20
15 control   5 15.90
16 control   6 16.54
17 control   7 18.00
18 control   8 14.40
19 control   9 16.41
20 control  10 16.00
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
dat2 <- tibble::tribble(
      ~trat, ~rep, ~comp,
      "Mg2",   1L,     9,
      "Mg2",   2L,  12.5,
      "Mg2",   3L,    10,
      "Mg2",   4L,     8,
      "Mg2",   5L,  13.2,
      "Mg2",   6L,    11,
      "Mg2",   7L,  10.8,
      "Mg2",   8L,   9.5,
      "Mg2",   9L,  10.8,
      "Mg2",  10L,  10.4,
  "control",   1L, 13.72,
  "control",   2L, 15.91,
  "control",   3L,  15.7,
  "control",   4L,  14.2,
  "control",   5L,  15.9,
  "control",   6L, 16.54,
  "control",   7L,    18,
  "control",   8L,  14.4,
  "control",   9L, 16.41,
  "control",  10L,    16
  )
dat2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```{.r .cell-code}
# 'dat' e 'dat2' são iguais, o que muda é a forma de vizualização dos dados no chunk.
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}

        ~`codigo`,            ~país,    ~`n2`,
               1L,         "Brazil",    4303L,
```

#Importando dados do R4PDE


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.0     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pepper <- 
  tribble(
   ~t,  ~`1`,  ~`2`,  ~`3`,
   0,  0.08, 0.001, 0.001,
   7,  0.13,  0.01, 0.001,
  14,  0.78,  0.09,  0.01,
  21,  0.92,  0.25,  0.05,
  28,  0.99,   0.8,  0.18,
  35, 0.995,  0.98,  0.34,
  42, 0.999,  0.99,  0.48,
  49, 0.999, 0.999,  0.74
  ) 
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pepper |>
  pivot_longer(2:4,
               names_to = "epidemic",
               values_to = "inc") |> 
  ggplot(aes(t, inc, color = epidemic))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_line()+
  annotate(geom = "text",
           x = 12,
           y = 0.79,
           label = "1")+
annotate(geom = "text",
           x = 26,
           y = 0.80,
           label = "2")+
  annotate(geom = "text",
           x = 47,
           y = 0.76,
           label = "3")+
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Tabela de Contigência


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggthemes)
cr <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/emdelponte/paper-coffee-rust-Ethiopia/master/data/survey_clean.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 405 Columns: 13
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (7): region, zone, district, cultivar, shade, cropping_system, farm_mana...
dbl (6): farm, lon, lat, altitude, inc, sev2

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#install.packages("janitor")
library(janitor)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```

Attaching package: 'janitor'

The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    chisq.test, fisher.test
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cr |> 
  tabyl(cultivar, farm_management)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 cultivar Intensive Minimal Moderate Unmanaged
 Improved        83       0        0         0
    Local         0      10        4       102
  Mixture        82      59       65         0
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cr |> 
  count(farm_management, cultivar) |> 
  ggplot(aes(cultivar, n, fill = farm_management,
             label = n))+
  geom_col(position = "dodge2")+
  scale_fill_canva()+
  theme_bw()+
  theme(strip.text.x = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "top")+
  geom_text(position = position_dodge(width = 0.9))+
  facet_wrap(~cultivar, scales = "free_x")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#geom_bar


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(gsheet)
mg <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=983033137")

mg |> 
  group_by(trat) |> 
  summarise(mean_comp = mean(comp), sd_comp = sd(comp))|> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, mean_comp))+
  geom_point(size = 3)+
  ylim(5,20)+
  #geom_col(fill = "steelblue", width = 0.5)+
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = mean_comp - sd_comp,
                    ymax = mean_comp + sd_comp), width = 0.1)+
  annotate (geom = "text",
           x = 1, y = 17.5,
           label = '*')
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mg |> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::
